data

Interface Data

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataTest, DataTrain

    public interface Data
    The interface Data handles with the data from input files, and its methods are associated with reading operations that allow the user to manipulate the data from a specific .csv file with the input format considered for this project.
    Author:
    Nuno Mendes, Sofia Silva, Tiago Ricardo

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[][] get()
      The method get() iterates over an ArrayList that includes the data read from the input files in order to put it into an array of integers.
      java.lang.String[] getNames()
      The method allows the user to access the names of the random variables.
      int getNumVA()
      The method returns the number of random variables.
      int getSize()
      The method returns the number of events.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        int[][] get()
        The method get() iterates over an ArrayList that includes the data read from the input files in order to put it into an array of integers. In the case of the training data, the array is bi-dimensional and it's two columns are relative to the values of the random variables in time-slices t and t+1, respectively.
        Returns:
        data Array of integers with the data retrieved from the input files.

      • getNames

        java.lang.String[] getNames()
        The method allows the user to access the names of the random variables. This access is made through an array of Strings with the data from the input files.
        Returns:
        names Array of strings with the names of the random variables.

      • getNumVA

        int getNumVA()
        The method returns the number of random variables.
        Returns:
        num_va Number of Random Variables

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        The method returns the number of events.
        Returns:
        size Number of Events.
